property.mod.cooldown.tooltip.p: When transporting resources duration of a cooldown is calculated by multiplying this number and volume of the resources transported.
The smaller this number is, the shorter cooldown is required after transportation.

property.healing.cost.mod.tooltip.p: Healing price of units is calculated by formula: unit price * damage percentage * this multiplier.
The smaller this number is, the cheaper your units can be healed.

text.deactivated.p: Buildings do not use energy while inactive. Activate this building to resume its operations. If it is upgrading it will activate itself upon completion.

text.cooldown.p: This building is currently cooling down and it can't perform it's functions yet.

NpcMetalExtractor.about.p: These alien technology driven foundries have been abandoned long time ago by their true owners. By now only hollow shell remains. However be cautious because the guardians are still there.

NpcZetiumExtractor.about.p: These buildings were used for extracting and storing zetium. They are mainly inactive now. However their defenses are still strong. Caution is advised.

NpcGeothermalPlant.about.p: Built ages ago these buildings were probably meant as collectors for geothermal heat that is hidden below them. Defeat guardians of this place and use that power for yourself!

NpcSolarPlant.about.p: Solar power is converted in these buildings. Our scans indicate strong energy output and multiple hostile units there. Act with caution.

NpcCommunicationsHub.about.p: These structures look like some kind of communication device. Perhaps they were used to bring messages to other worlds?

NpcTemple.about.p: Whilst extremely advanced Precursors were also a deeply religious race. They gathered in this building to pray to their gods. The land on which it is standing is sacred and heavily guarded.

NpcExcavationSite.about.p: It seems like a dig site. Although nobody knows what they were searching for it is still guarded by hostile units.

NpcResearchCenter.about.p: It seems that this is a Precursor research laboratory. No one knows what is inside only that outside of it is guarded by swarms of robots.

NpcJumpgate.about.p: These jumpgates were used to warp forces between planets crossing solar systems in mere seconds. Even if they do not function anymore there is still great defenses set up to forbid strangers from entering its vicinity.

Mothership.about.p: [reference:Objects/Building_Mothership] is the core ship for humans who inhabit this planet. They came here in this ship and used it as a shelter from harsh winds on this wild planet.
Each [reference:Objects/Building_Mothership] has a basic MEX and some solar cells integrated in it and can provide a colony with most basic metal and energy needs.

ResourceTransporter.about.p: Resource transporter can instantaneously transfer a certain amount of resources from one planet to another. Connecting two such buildings forms a space tunnel between the two planets.

Although scientists have not yet been able to successfully perform transportation of a live being, this technology is suitable for fast transfer of resource. However a small portion of resources being transferred is lost in the process.

MEX.common.p: Each MEX can be upgraded to increase it's effectiveness and extract more metal. However by doing so it also requires more energy to operate.
MEXes will shut down if you do not have energy to run them.
Each upgrade level increases metal extraction rate.

MetalExtractor.about.p: Built on ore mountains they are used to extract metal from dirt and rumble. Metal Extractors (MEXes) are facilities that provide metal by eating up through mountains and bringing its ore supplies up to the surface.

MetalExtractorT2.common.p: Better, faster and more expensive version of [reference:MetalExtractor.name].

MetalStorage.about.p: As MEXes rip through the ore not all metal is used up immediately. Excess metal is stored in these giant structures. When the time comes it is released from these containers and used in construction of our fleets and buildings.

CollectorT1.common.p: These wind panels are used to provide basic needs of energy to all buildings and construction. They can be upgraded relatively easy and are cheap and cost effective to produce if you have enough space.

CollectorT1.about.p: Each upgrade level increases energy output.

CollectorT2.common.p: These solar collectors are used to provide massive amounts of energy to all buildings and construction. They have been designed using technologies of Precursors and therefore generate much more energy than conventional wind panels.

CollectorT2.about.p: Each upgrade level increases energy output.

CollectorT3.common.p: Geothermal vents are rarely found on planets. However they are powerful and this building allow you to use that power. They are the most effective means of generating energy and gives best cost to performance ratio.

CollectorT3.about.p: Each upgrade level increases energy output.

EnergyStorage.about.p: These large batteries keep vast amounts of excess energy to be used later. Due to their massiveness most of the structure is buried underground.
Each upgrade level increases energy storage.

Barracks.about.p: Finest men are trained here to do battle in our cause. They undergo best physical and mental training there are equipped by powerful combat suits and weapons to aid them in combat.

ResearchCenter.about.p: Greatest minds of each planet work here to bring technological advancements to our civilization. Do notice that even if these researches often require much resources and manpower to bring visions alive they are well proven to be worth the cost.
It is essential that you have at least one of these research centers or your opponents will eventually overtake you with their superior technology.
Each upgrade level increases number of available scientists.

ZetiumExtractor.common.p: Zetium extractors will shut down if you do not have energy to run them.
Each upgrade level increases zetium extraction rate.

ZetiumExtractorT2.common.p: Better, faster and more expensive version of [reference:ZetiumExtractor.name]. By using alien technologies these structures will provide your most advanced zetium needs.

ZetiumStorage.about.p: After extracting zetium crystals are melted and stored as liquid. This is the only form allowing for later reuse of the material, however it is highly unstable and even slightest distortion could leave nothing behind.

Crane.about.p: These gigantic cranes are very helpful in raising new colonies. Their price is insignificant compared to their ability to have many orders. Using few of these cranes commander can fully build a new colony in a few days.

Market.common.p: Market allows you to trade with other players in this galaxy. Matter converters allow sending and receiving goods instantaneously, however galaxy market dealers will require a fee to list your offers on their networks.

Market.about.p: Each upgrade level decreases offer submission fee.

Radar.common.p: These massive buildings are used for deep space telemetry. As they drain energy from our generators they can see planets in our and other solar systems. Furthermore it even registers fleet movements in galaxy and solar systems giving us insight at what is happening in our neighborhood.

Radar.about.p: Each upgrade level increases distance it can see.

Housing.about.p: These living pods create living space needed for our troops and crews of our tanks and ships.
If you're out of living space you cannot support more units in your army. In such case you have to build new pods or upgrade existing ones.

Headquarters.about.p: Deployed from Mobile Deployable Headquarters it is the first outpost in a foreign colony. Provided with enough metal and energy for initial construction it is the seed from which a thriving colony grows.
Headquarters allow you to construct buildings.

Vulcan.about.p: Defensive stationary turret especially effective against lightly armored units. Equipped with 6 CX-60 high speed cannons it can shed through armies quickly dealing enormous damage.
Only capable of hitting ground units.

Screamer.about.p: Equipped with twin ROCKO-3 heavy rocket launchers this stationary turret is best retaliation against tanks and heavy units.
Only capable of hitting ground units.

Thunder.about.p: Firing plasma balls capable of reaching suborbital levels it is your best bet against enemy crafts and bombers. Its projectiles detonate upon impact dealing massive damage.
Only capable of hitting space units.

GroundFactory.about.p: A great technological advancement allowing us to build tanks and other advanced ground units. You will require this building to construct [reference:Objects/Unit_Mdh] which enables colonization of other planets.

SpaceFactory.about.p: From the humble [reference:Units/Crow.name] scout class vessel to the great [reference:Units/Rhyno.name] battleship - [reference:SpaceFactory.name] brings it all at your disposal.

HealingCenter.common.p: [reference:HealingCenter.name] is a complex of medical care facilities and technical repair factories. It allows you to heal your wounded infantry and repair tanks and spaceships back to their full potential.

HealingCenter.about.p: Each level reduces healing cost and cooldown.

DefensivePortal.common.p: When activated this portal allows you sending troops to other planets for defense. It also allows other units to travel to planet it is built on to aid in its defense.
Beware that it can only accept a fixed amount of volume from other planets. If you want bigger reinforcements you'll have to either upgrade the portal or build more of them.

DefensivePortal.about.p: Each level increases incoming teleportation volume.

NpcInfantryFactory.about.p: This ancient factory produces light units out of solar energy and silicone it synthesizes within it.

NpcTankFactory.about.p: Powerful and heavily armed machines are created in this laboratory.

NpcSpaceFactory.about.p: This underground facility constructs spacecraft which can be used for defense and galactic conquest.

NpcHall.about.p: Holding planets with this building on them brings you and your alliance victory points. Collect enough of them and become the supreme ruler of this galaxy!

Tips.tip.0: Building energy generators on this land will grant you additional energy rate bonus.
Tips.tip.1: Building construction buildings on a flat land will increase their construction speed later.
Tips.tip.2: If you're not sure what building or unit does, click on Info icon to learn more.
Tips.tip.3: Don't build turrets on rocky ground! They will lose armor and perish in battle faster!
Tips.tip.4: Look for strong dark ground to build your turrets on. This ground gives them additional armor.
Tips.tip.5: You can zoom in and out using your mouse wheel or plus/minus signs in top-left map corner.
Tips.tip.6: When in battle units in your first flank have 70% chance of being hit while second flank has only 30%. Keep your important units in second flank.
Tips.tip.7: You can click blue arrows in unit construction window to skim through available units quickly.
Tips.tip.8: Occupy planets in battlegrounds and pulsars to get reinforcements, victory points and creds.
Tips.tip.9: Double click player name in chat room to send private message.
Tips.tip.10: Wreckages in space can be collected by flying over them with Mule transporter ship.
Tips.tip.11: Important notifications can be marked with star. This way notifications will be stored longer.
Tips.tip.12: You can heal your own and alliances units together. Just select your units, switch to alliances tab, select allies units and click "Heal".

about.10.p: We have landed in this planet with our [reference:Buildings/Mothership.name] and our preliminary scouting have reported that it seems we are not alone. We have set up our base but is is draining more energy than our generators can produce. This cannot continue for long!
You must build a [reference:Buildings/CollectorT1.name] to fulfill our energy needs. Do not waste time. Do it now!

about.20.p: I see you did well, Commander.
Our energy levels are now normal. However, it seems we are stuck here. At least for now.
The good thing is that we have spotted ore deposits nearby. We should build a [reference:Buildings/MetalExtractor.name] to draw metal from one of those deposits.
Our future rests in your hands, Commander.

about.30.p: It seems that our extractors are working properly. However, we need more resources to keep our growth steady. Upgrade extractors so that they fulfill our needs.

about.40.p: Resource extraction is our top priority! Build even more extractors so that extraction rates become steady for sure.

about.50.p: Our scouts report hearing strange noises in the wind. Suspicions that we are not alone have been confirmed. Our scanners are picking up strange anomalies in this planet. Until we know what we are dealing with, we can't feel safe only behind the thick walls.
We need troops. Order construction of [reference:Buildings/Barracks.name] now.
Our people need to feel safe.

about.60.p: Construction of your [reference:Buildings/Barracks.name] has been complete as ordered. We now must train more troops to defend ourselves. Go to the [obj:1:Building_Barracks::dc] and order training of [obj:2:Unit_Trooper::dc].

about.70.p: A few lightly guarded alien buildings have been located outside of our base territory. We should attack and destroy them. Our troops need this kind of exercise. Even better, alien wreckages will replenish our supplies.

Intelligence estimates that an alien [obj:1:Unit_Gnat] is of the same strength as our [obj:1:Unit_Trooper]. I suggest sending a few extra troops to the battle so that we would gain an advantage over the alien forces.

about.80.p: Our colony is prospering. We have steady resource income, our troops are strong and fearless, our people feel safe and last but not least - the weather is nice. It's almost like I can call this place home.

This wonderful day is perfect for laying ground for our future. [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] would be a great start. We already have a group of our colonists that would apply to work there. We do not want to make them wait, do we?
My recommendation? You should order construction of a [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] in this planet at once. After all, one or two tricks from the science fun bag won't hurt us, will it?

about.90.p: Our scouts located interesting object nearby. It seems to be remains of some giant creature. Unfortunately, they do no have the knowledge for making a fair assessment of the finding and only reported that they had found "some bones".
Still it would be best if you would send team of explorers to check it out. Perhaps they can find something useful.

about.100.p: Our scouts have detected a few strange buildings guarded by alien robots. They managed to take some samples of the material lying around them and our researchers were working on the samples for quite some time.
It seems that those buildings are full of zetium, a new crystal material. Looks like it is very useful and can be used in many ways, even interstellar space travel. We need those crystals!
Its about time the crystals are freed of the alien heels. Order our scientists to begin researching the technology required for this material processing immediately.

about.110.p: Our research on [reference:Technologies/ZetiumExtraction.name] has payed of. We are now able to build much needed buildings that will extract precious zetium from these crystals.
Of course we must get rid of those aliens occupying zetium fields. Assemble a strong army and attack the alien buildings if you haven't done it yet.

about.120.p: Our troops have been injured! We need some way to heal them. Tell scientists to begin researching [reference:Objects/Technology_HealingCenter] technology. Once they have completed the task, build it immediately.

about.130.p: I'm afraid I've miscalculated when saying "there can't be too much of resources". Our analytics have presented me with a plan of resource extraction and energy production rates covering a few cycles. According to their prognosis we won't be able to consume everything we are currently producing. Although it may sound as bad news, in fact it is not. All we have to do is build some additional storage buildings to store excess resources.
Order construction of buildings that store each resource type, Commander.

about.140.p: Each and every empire needs strong economy. We must be prepared for unexpectedly high demand for resources. Let's upgrade our mining facilities.

about.150.p: In different times we need different things and it's not always easy to plan ahead. Research a [obj:1:Technology_Market] technology so that we could trade with other inhabitants of this galaxy.
After all they might be in need of something we have surplus and vice versa. Why shouldn't we help each other? We could even make a friend or two in this way.

about.160.p: We need more space for our people. Soon enough we won't have any rooms left.

about.170.p: Our scientists have found a way to use zetium in space travel! This is a glorious day! Order them to start researching of [reference:Technologies/SpaceFactory.name] now.
We need plans in order to build the factory so do not hesitate!

about.180.p: Space factory project and specifications of technologies to be used have already been handed over to builders. Our hard-working colonists are eager to grab their tools and begin the work. Order construction of a [obj:1:Building_SpaceFactory::dc] in this planet.
Pay attention to those grey and level fields. They seem to be a perfect place for construction. If we build the factory there, work will be completed much sooner.

about.190.p: We have built our [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name]. Now we need ships to travel space. Unfortunately we cannot rely only on our [reference:Units/Mule.name] class transporter ships. They are strongly armored however without any offensive power they will be ripped apart in seconds by alien ships hovering above planets and other objects in our solar system.
We need combat ships to counter them. Go to your [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name] and order construction of your first [obj:1:Unit_Crow] class ship.

about.200.p: Our scanners have picked up an enemy space ship orbiting our planet. It is definitely spying on us!
Assemble a fleet, lift it to the planet orbit and shoot down the enemy spy.

about.210.p: Now that we have mastered space travel we should start expanding to the other planets. Our sensors indicate there is a nearby planet that can sustain life. However it is guarded by alien ships.
Use your fleet to destroy the guards and take over that planet.
To annex a planet we must land our ships on its soil.

about.220.p: Let me congratulate you on taking ownership of the second planet. We are now officially a multi-planetary civilization! Of course we still need to build our base there and many other task awaits.
Our first task - development of second planet's economy. We need to construct resource extractors so that we can further advance growth of the colony.
So let us not waste any time and start working.

about.230.p: Its an awful mess down there after that battle - we've got wreckages floating everywhere. We should clean it up.
Why the frowned face? Oh, I must have forgotten to mention that those wreckages can be used as resources in our worlds. Heh, I see you're smiling already.
And for that we will need a mule class ship. Right on! Lets collect those resources! Build your first mule class ship!

about.240.p: As we have built our [reference:Buildings/SpaceFactory.name] we should train our pilots a bit! As an easy first task go pick on some [obj:2:Unit_Dirac].

about.250.p: Your recent activity in this region has made alien ships more cautious. Some rumors even tell they are planning a rebellion! Go and destroy their powerful [reference:Units/Thor.name] class ships. Show them who rules this galaxy!

about.260.p: It seems there is no stopping those alien ships. You must strike at their strongest spot to make them bow down to your might! It is the only way to stop the rebellion!

about.270.p: We now have plenty of space in our new colony. After establishing an operational base we should begin exploring our galaxy.
Build a [reference:Buildings/Radar.name]. It will reveal a sector of galaxy map. You will be able to see other solar systems ruled by other players and ship movement within that sector.

Keep in mind that running a [reference:Buildings/Radar.name] requires substantial amount of energy. It will drain your energy storage quickly if you do not have enough energy generated. And if it runs out of energy - it will simply shut down keeping you blind from enemy actions.

about.280.p: Our [obj:1:Building_Radar::dc] have been completed and we now see that other solar systems with unoccupied planets exist. Our strategists say that one more planet would be of a great use for us. However, to colonise it we need some special equipment that can only be produced in a [obj:1:Building_GroundFactory::dc].
So do not hesitate. Begin researching [obj:1:Technology_GroundFactory] technology immediately.

about.290.p: We already have a ground factory. We now require [obj:1:Technology_Mdh] technology, or [obj:1:Unit_Mdh] for short. The [obj:1:Unit_Mdh] had already been deployed in our second planet once we arrived there. However that probably is only a fortunate coincidence.

Since the travel will take a great deal of time it would be unpleasant if an [obj:1:Unit_Mdh] wasn't already on the planet. So our own unit will come in handy since we want to colonise that third planet.

about.300.p: The [obj:1:Technology_Mdh] technology is now at our disposal. The only thing left for us to do is fly to another solar system and take control of a third planet.

Use your [obj:1:Building_GroundFactory::dc] to build an [obj:1:Unit_Mdh] unit. Load that unit to a [obj:1:Unit_Mule] class ship and send it to a third planet along with an escort. Do not forget to bring along some ground troops - the planet will probably be guarded by alien forces.

about.310.p: Our intelligence reports the attack by alien forces on our third colony is imminent. We must build up defences quickly to ensure safety of our people.
You have been rewarded with a few mobile turrets for the completion of your last task. You can claim them directly to your third planet and deploy the turrets there.

about.320.p: We require new technologies to boost our economy in the new planet. Our scientists think that after analyzing alien mining facilities they could adapt their technologies for increasing resource extraction rates.

Research new extractor technologies and build those advanced extractors in the third planet. And do not forget to replace our old mining facilities in other two planets with more advanced counterparts.

about.330.p: Turns out this galaxy is much larger than we have anticipated. And in such a huge galaxy fighting alone is very difficult.

Contact other commanders and become a member of an alliance. You can research [obj:1:Technology_Alliances] technology and create your own alliance or you can expect someone to invite you to an already existing alliance.

about.340.p: In order to win, we together with our allies need to collect a certain amount of Victory Points, or VPs for short. Try to collect a few VPs and you will be generously rewarded.

about.10010.p: There are lots and lots of alien mines draining the precious metal deposits.
We must get rid of them so that construction of our own extractors would be possible.

EconomySideQuest.about.p: The colonists and the base crew admire the growth of the power of our economy. But we can't stop at the halfway. Let us increase our industrial potential. Let us not stop the progress!

WarSideQuest.about.p: Galaxy is dangerous and unquiet place. Of course, we are peaceful people, but the dangers around us may recognize our sober minds as a sign of fear and a lack of strong will. We must defend ourselves against predatory neighbours. And the best defence... yes, you've guessed right, Commander - is a good offence! Let's launch a preemptive strike on them!
Remember that prevention of evil intention is a legitimate way of defence. Do not waver. Attack the alien forces without fear each time you encounter them. We can't reason with them anyway.

about.10160.p: As a great leader you have brought us many victories. All your efforts are appreciated.

about.10180.p: All our neighbors know of your skills. You are truly worthy. Keep it up!

about.10190.p: People who have not been lucky enough to thrive and prosper under your ruling do not understand the meaning of those words. But we do. We are grateful for that, Commander.
I am speaking on behalf of all the people of our colonies.

about.10200.p: You are known in whole sector of this galaxy. Billions of mothers name their suns after you. Our allies respect you and our enemies fear you.

about.10210.p: You are a leader in economy, science and war. We are leaders everywhere. Have you considered creating your own religion?

ScienceSideQuest.about.p: Inventions! Progress! Science is the key for our advancement. Enemies may build more fleets but we will build better ones! Invest into research and you'll see that it is worth its price.

TechnologySideQuest.about.p: This technology is extremely important for our future development. Research it and you will be greatly awarded.

about.10400.p: In our [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name] a lot of scientists are eager to explore. Our scouts have discovered quite a few interesting objects in this planet and we have people burning to go there.
I suggest we try exploring those objects. I am certain there is more to discover.

about.10405.p: Explorers are back but they are burning of their desire to continue the search. By all means we should let them do it.

about.10410.p: Bringing a bunch of those alien robots really made the crowd crazy in our, ehrm, excuse me, jar-head lab. They demand we mount an even bigger expedition to another object. They say they found some references that they might find one of these [reference:Units/Glancer.name] robots down there. And that would certainly prove useful to us.
I say let them go. Order a mega-exploration mission.

about.10415.p: Scholars say that somewhere around the unexplored objects we could find a whole army! Would you like to try, Commander?

about.10420.p: They are out of their minds!
Our scientists want to mount yet another expedition. To the huge mountain out there. However it requires a lot of personnel and we probably don't have enough right now.
We need to upgrade our [reference:Buildings/ResearchCenter.name]. Beware that while upgrading you won't be able to research any technologies.
It is up to you, Commander.

about.10425.p: Remember that research expedition you sent out recently? They are back and they brought alien robots with them! Of course they are a bit damaged but our scientists have managed to turn them on. They are now loyal servants of yours! Isn't that wonderful news?

Oh, that research team also brought back some resources with them. Perhaps it would be wise to continue our exploration of that site? You never know what you might find there... It could prove very useful.

about.10450.p: Make sure we have enough units to easily defend ourselves or even strike first! We must be strong and prepared!

about.10460.p: In your last mission you were rewarded with some creds. Go and take your reward if you haven't done so already.

Creds are a useful and powerful tool. They can be spent on various tasks like accelerating your constructions, researches and unit training. They can even be used for moving buildings or speeding up fleets!

And how do you get more creds? You can buy them from our shop which is accessible from N44 menu in bottom-left corner. You can also gain them by conquering and holding special battleground planets about which you will learn later.
And you can become a VIP. Becoming a VIP gives you more creds than you spend on the VIP service and allows you to use them daily as you see fit.
So go, order your first VIP and be rewarded greatly!

title.10470.value: Could you work a little faster?

about.10470.p: Congratulations on becoming a VIP, Commander.
As of now you have a daily number of creds to spend so why not spend some on something that is really useful?
I suggest we accelerate construction of any building. There are plenty of different buildings we will need sooner of later. Speed up their construction with creds.

about.10500.p: It is time to expand your empire. Gain another colony so we could thrive there! Make our ancestors proud.

about.10510.p: Even if we have conquered that pesky world we should not stop with it. There is much ground to cover. Go and conquer yet another world. Make it fall to the might of our empire!

about.10520.p: With such area under your influence, only further reach is to infinity and beyond! Our empire is unstoppable!

DestroyingEnemies.about.p: Shake the grounds of our enemies' power! Let us destroy the cornerstone of their empire - annihilate enemy forces.

about.10600.p: Our scouts has tracked alien convoys flying near our solar system from time to time. They have some weird ships in their fleets.
After some discussions our scientists has calculated that we could get good reward after destroying these convoys! Should we give it a try?

about.10610.p: Morpehus has been spotted in battleground! This extremely powerful alien ship shows itself from time to time and there are lots of legends about them traveling around the galaxy.

If you could manage to destroy this ship we will get truly great reward! Just be careful and don't attack this ship alone or your fleet can get destroyed in a moment. You should ask for help from your allies!

QuestScreens.BuildingSidebar:
You can find all the buildings you can construct at the right sidebar.

Once you select a building, you can see the bonuses provided by terrain under the building at the bottom of the right sidebar.

If another building is already being constructed the next is added to the construction queue.
QuestScreens.ClaimReward:
You get reward for each quest you complete. You can take it by navigating to the quests screen: open Nebula 44 menu at the bottom left corner of the screen and click "[reference:MainMenu/label.quests]" button.

Then you have to find a completed quest - they are marked as yellow - and click on a '[reference:Quests/label.claimReward]' button
QuestScreens.OreTile: You can build MEX's on the top of metal deposits only. Most of the time you will find alien structures standing on them already. Those structures must be destroyed before building your own extractor. However you may find some free deposits as well.
QuestScreens.BuildingUpgrade:
Buildings can be upgraded. To do that select a building by clicking it at the planet map. Then click "[reference:BuildingSelectedSidebar/upgrade]" button in the menu at the right.

Upgraded buildings improves their characteristics: extractors produce more resources, factories take less time to build units, more scientists are able to work in research centers and so on.
QuestScreens.EnergyTiles:
Although you are free to build power plants anywhere it is recommended to place them on a special terrain to boost power.

Bonus of the terrain you are choosing to build your plant is displayed at the bottom of the right sidebar.
QuestScreens.ConstructionTiles: Buildings will be constructed more quickly on this terrain. By the way, if a building is able to construct other buildings, train troops or manufacture tanks or ships, it will take less time to complete its task. So this type of terrain is best for all kinds of factories.
QuestScreens.SpeedupConstruction1: You may speed up long taking constructions using special game resource called creds. To do that, select a building. Then click "Speed up" button and choose the speed up level.
QuestScreens.SpeedupConstruction2:
You can buy creds by clicking "Buy creds" button in the N44 menu.

You can also get some creds by completing quests. You have been rewarded with creds after completing your last quest. Claim that reward and speed up construction of a building!
QuestScreens.UnitConstructors:
Some buildings are designed to train soldiers, tanks or spaceships.

You can build units by selecting a building (i.e. [reference:Objects/Building_Barracks]) and pressing [reference:BuildingSelectedSidebar/open] in the sidebar.
QuestScreens.UnitConstructionScreen:
You can reach unit building screen using any unit facility. You can manage all the units being built in current planet there.

In order to train soldiers, select the needed amount and press "build" button.
QuestScreens.TakeUnitsReward:
The quest you have just completed rewards you with troops. Before starting next quest it is advised to claim this reward.

Go to the N44 menu, press the "[reference:MainMenu/label.quests]" button, select previously completed quest and click "[reference:Quests/label.claimReward]".
QuestScreens.UnitScreen: In the top right corner of the screen you can see the number of units you have. Pressing that number will bring you to the unit management panel where you can adjust your battle strategy.
QuestScreens.AttackButton: In order to attack alien building you have to select it and press the "[reference:BuildingSelectedSidebar/attack]" button in the sidebar.
QuestScreens.AttackScreen:
In the opened panel you can select troops which you want to participate in the battle.

In most cases, all troops are selected. You can select them by pressing "[reference:Units/label.all]" button in the sidebar.

When you have selected troops, press "[reference:Units/label.attack]".
QuestScreens.ClaimRewardRC:
You have just completed the quest which gives you necessary resources for your future development - zetium. You will also receive creds for your great job.

DON'T forget to claim your reward!
QuestScreens.DamagedUnits: Your troops had been injured in the battle. They could be healed, if you invented the technology, enabling you to build [reference:Objects/Building_HealingCenter].
QuestScreens.Exploring:
There are objects in the planet which you can explore. In order to do so select the object and press [reference:Exploration/label.explore] on the right sidebar.

Scientists will be sent to an expedition and will inform you about results afterwards.
QuestScreens.Notifications:
You can find results of finished expeditions and other events in the notification panel. Access it by pressing notification icon in the top left corner.

If you want to find out more about notification, visit Nebula 44 Wiki, you can find it by going to the N44 menu.
QuestScreens.TechTree:
You can find the technology tree in Research Center. You can see all the technologies you can research in there.

You can't invent greyed out technologies yet while technologies in red background requires more scientists or resources than you currently hold.
QuestScreens.TechResearch1: In order to invent a technology you have to select it first. Afterwards press the "[reference:Technologies/upgrade]" button in the sidebar.
QuestScreens.TechResearch2: Technologies are invented by the selected amount of scientists. The more scientists will work on a technology, the faster they will finish.
QuestScreens.WPInTechs:
Some technologies may be locked at the beginning - you will have to reach certain amounts of war points.

You can check your war points amount in the N44 menu.

So far the easiest way to collect war points is to clear your planet from aliens.
QuestScreens.ZetiumTile: You can built ZEX on the zetium crystals. They are rarely found unoccupied so you will have to destroy alien building above crystals first.
QuestScreens.Resources:
There are three types of resources in Nebula 44: metal, energy and zetium. Small amounts of them are stored in the Mothership while larger amounts are stored in a specialized containers.

Metal is mostly used for building troops and buildings. Energy is being used for construction and it is also consumed by buildings such as MEX's, ZEX's, Radars and so on. Zetium is used for constructing powerful tanks and spaceships as well as for researching technologies.
QuestScreens.ResourceBar: You can track your resources, see storage size and extraction speed by hovering your mouse over resource zone located at the bottom of the screen.
QuestScreens.Market1:
Market screen is splitted in two parts: buying (the large one) and selling (right sidebar).

In the buying screen you can see all the offers, you can filter them and find what you are looking for.
QuestScreens.Market2: After selecting the offer you can choose the amount you want to buy by using the slider at the bottom of the screen.
QuestScreens.Population:
Your troops consumes vital resources - oxygen, food and water. It influences the amount of troops you can maintain. This amount is displayed at the top right corner of the screen next to the troops amount.

If you exceed your vital resources, your troops will become weaker so it is mandatory to have enough space for them.
QuestScreens.UnitScreenWithSpace:
If you have spaceships as well as ground units the number of spaceships will be shown next to the ground units amount in the top right corner.

By pressing that number you will find yourself in a spaceships' management screen where you can send them to the space.

In that screen you can quickly switch to the ground units screen by using buttons above first flank.
QuestScreens.SendingShips1:
If you want to send your spaceships to the space open the spaceship management panel.

Then select spaceships and press "[reference:Units/label.issueOrder]".
QuestScreens.SendingShips2: The map of the solar system will be opened. Press on the desired sector and then click the "[reference:Movement/label.toSector]" button.
QuestScreens.CombatInSpace:
Your spaceships will scan the area once they reach it. If there are any enemy ships your fleet will prepare for a battle and attack.

If enemy fleet isn't destroyed at the first time your ships will retreat, rearrange (it takes some time) and attack again until there are only friendly units in the sector.
QuestScreens.MoveToPlanet:
You can command your fleet even if it is in space. Just select one of your fleet and press the "[reference:Movement/label.move]" button. Then select the sector you want to move to.

If you want your fleet to move into planet press on the planet and click "[reference:Movement/label.toPlanet]" button.
QuestScreens.ClaimPlanet:
If there are no enemy forces in the planet you can take it over. All the buildings and resources in the planet will become yours.

To claim a planet you have to click the "[reference:BuildingSidebar/label.claimPlanet]" button in the sidebar.
QuestScreens.Wreckage:
After a battle some debris remain which can be used as resources.

If a battle took place in a planet, debris is automatically collected and put in storage containers.

If a battle took place in space, debris remain in a sector until someone collects them. In order to collect them you have to move to the sector with a mule class transporter ship.
QuestScreens.LoadWreckage1:
Being in a sector with debris select your fleet and press "[reference:Squadrons/label.manage]"

In the fallowing window press the load button.
QuestScreens.LoadWreckage2:
Select the amount of resources you want to carry and confirm your decision

Close the resource and spacehip windows in order to go back to the space.
QuestScreens.UnloadResources:
When you come back to a planet go to the spaceship management panel and press the "Unload" button.

Select amount of resources you want to unload and confirm your decision. Close resources and spaceships screens in order to go back to the planet
QuestScreens.Radar1: There are many other players in the galaxy but you need to build a Radar to see other solar systems or travel there.
QuestScreens.Radar2:
A radar consumes energy. It reveals a small galaxy area around your solar system while it is active. The visible area expands as you upgrade the radar.

Also, you can take ownership of planets in other solar systems and build radars there to expand visible area even more.
QuestScreens.LoadUnits:
If you wish to conquer other planet you need some ground units which can be transported by using Mule transporter ship.

Go to your space units screen, then press "Load" button next to a Mule. Afterwards, select units you want to load and click "Load" button at the right sidebar.

Remember, you must have MDH and some ground units if you want to colonize other planets.
QuestScreens.UnloadUnits: After landing on the planet click "Unload" button next to your Mule. Select your units and click "Unload" button at the right sidebar.
QuestScreens.DeployMdh:
Your Headquarters is still in its mobile form. You need to deploy it if you want to create a colony.

Navigate to the units screen, click on the "deploy" button next to the MDH and choose ground area where you want to deploy the Headquarters.
QuestScreens.DeployTurrets: You have been rewarded with a few mobile turrets for completing your last quest. Claim and deploy them on the new colony - they will serve us as a great defense line.
QuestScreens.ThirdPlanet:
Your third planet is in open solar system. That means it can be attacked by other players at any given time. Also it will we attacked by allien pirates from time to time.

If you want to learn more about alien pirates you should read info in Nebula 44 wiki which can be found in N44 menu.
QuestScreens.ArmorTiles: Deploy your turrets on dark ground - it is strong and provides additional armor for the turrets so they will be harder to destroy.
QuestScreens.EcoTier2:
It is recommended to renew your economical base right after you research new generation extractors.

To replace an old extractor version with a new one, one has to destroy that old extractor first and build the new one at its place.
QuestScreens.JoinAlliance: You may join an alliance as soon as you get an invitation which appears in your notification center.
QuestScreens.CreateAlliance:
If you want to create your own alliance, you need to research Alliances technology.

After that go to N44 menu and click [reference:MainMenu/label.alliance] button. You can create your new alliance in this screen.
QuestScreens.InviteToAlliance: After you create your own alliance you can invite other players to join it. To do that, go to N44 menu and click [reference:MainMenu/label.alliance] button. Then, at the top of the screen choose a [reference:Alliances/title.section.management] tab and use the player list to invite new allies.
QuestScreens.BgBattles: You and your alliance get victory points for battles with other players in the battleground. Victory points are vital for winning the game.
QuestScreens.BgPlanets:
Planets in the battleground are special. Owner of such planet (as well as his or her alliance) periodically gets victory points. The longer you own this planet the more victory points you collect.

Owning more battleground planets does not increase the alien pirate armies on ordinary planets.
QuestScreens.BossShip: Morpheus also shows itself up in the battleground time to time. It is a mighty alien ship which is extreamly hard to destroy. You get creds for destroying this ship and victory points for damage dealt.
QuestScreens.Pulsars:
Pulsars are smaller versions of battleground in localized galaxy areas. You get much less victory points for owning them.

Owning more pulsar planets does not increase alien pirate armies on ordinary planets.
QuestScreens.Convoys: Alien convoys are flying near our solar system from time to time. These ships are well equiped with weapons but you get creds for killing them. You get victory points for damage dealt to them too.
QuestScreens.GalaxyBattles:
You will also get some smaller amount of victory points for fighting other players in galaxy, solar systems or planets.

Besides, justice codex is active in the galaxy - you won't get any reward if you destroy a much weaker player than yourself.

tooltip.deathDay.p: Player lost his last planet at {0}

specialPlanets.common.p: Special planets are located in battleground or pulsar solar systems.

tooltip.planetsVsBattleground.p: Regular planets count / Special planets count

allianceVictoryPoints.long.p: Victory points earned for alliance by its players.

message.battleground.p: Taking and holding planets in this solar system gives you Victory Points, Creds and Units.

message.planetRenamed.value: Your planet name has been changed to {0}.

tooltip.allianceFull.p: Kick existing players or upgrade your Alliances technology to invite this player.

buildCenters.p: Build or upgrade Research Centers to increase the number of your scientists.

notEnoughScientists.p: This technology needs {0 one[one scientist] many[? scientists]}. However only {1 one[one scientist] many[? scientists]} out of {2 one[one scientist] many[? scientists]} are available.

notEnoughScientistsExploration.p: You don't have enough scientists to explore this object.

warPointsNeeded.p: You need {0} war points to research this technology but you only have {1}.
You can get more war points by attacking NPCs or other players.

planetsNeeded.p: You need to own {0 one[? planet] many[? planets]} to be able to research this technology, but you only own {1}.

pulsarsNeeded.p: You have to rule {0} battleground or pulsar {0 one[planet] many[planets]} to be able to research this technology, but you only have {1}.

groupResearched.p: Another technology in this group has been already researched so you cannot research this technology

Technologies.warning.unlearn: Warning! It will cost you {0 one[? cred] many[? creds]} to unlearn this technology and you won't get any resources back.

isGroup.p: If you research this technology you won't be able to research:

property.mod.critical.tooltip.p: Chance of unit firing a critical shot.
Critical shot is a shot that inflicts {0} times more damage.

property.mod.absorption.tooltip.p: Probability of a unit being hit by a shot that does {0} times less damage.

property.mod.speed.tooltip.p: For example 100% means that ship will move 2 times faster.

UnitTech.p: First level of this technology unlocks described unit. Other levels upgrade it.

GroundUpgrade.p: Each level increases unit armor, weapons damage as well as chances of damage absorption and critical shot.

SpaceUpgrade.p: Each level increases ship armor, weapons damage, chances of damage absorption and critical shot as well as movement speed.

BuildingTech.p: First level of this technology unlocks described building. Other levels upgrade it.

Zetium.common.p: Zetium is a rare crystal that has incredible properties. Combined with other technologies it allows for making of great buildings, ships and weapons. These crystals are also essential to our space engines and most other advanced technologies.

ArmorSpecialization.about.p: This specialization increases armor and reduces damage received.

CriticalSpecialization.about.p: This specialization increases the chance of critical shot.

AbsorptionSpecialization.about.p: This specialization increases chance of absorbing a portion of damage received when unit is hit.

SpeedSpecialization.about.p: This specialization increases movement speed of the ship.

ZetiumExtraction.about.p: Allows building Zetium Extractors and Storages.

CriticalTech.value: Researching this technology increases chance of critical shot

AbsorptionTech.value: Researching this technology increases chance of damage absorption

SpeedTech.value: Researching this technology increases movement speed

DamageAbout.p: Incorporating zetium into projectiles and rockets increases damage caused by their explosions and lets you be sure that enemy troops won't leave the battlefield alive.

ArmorAbout.p: This technology lets us use zetium for manufacturing firm but at the same time light layered armor. This greatly increases protection from enemy bullets and shells.

CriticalAbout.p: Perfected targeting and navigation systems aids in finding weakest spots of enemy defences and strike with a full force.

AbsorptionAbout.p: Advanced defence systems lets protect ourselves from some of the incoming shells of the enemy which greatly decreases damage inflicted by them.

HeavyFlight.about.p: Employing gamma particles in our heavy engine inner processes allows us to reach higher velocities thus reducing time we need to make those little hops in solar systems and galaxies.
However this technology requires UX-20 engines which can only be found in our biggest ships. As it is they are also slowest, so this technology is very valuable for them.
Shortens flight times for [reference:Objects/Unit_Mule] and [reference:Objects/Unit_Rhyno] class ships.

LightFlight.about.p: This technology allows reducing weight of our ships which in turn increases their speed.

FieryMelters.about.p: Using high pressure in metal extractors allows getting higher metal extraction and storage efficiency. Although this technology is a bit pricey it may be worth investing to if your metal needs are growing.
Each level increases metal extraction rate and storage.

SuperconductorTechnology.about.p: By using zetium coated wires our scientists are able to increase their throughput and use our energy more efficiently. This increases our energy generation rates and storage capacities. Investing in this technology may prove useful if you are falling short on energy.
Each level increases energy generation rate and storage.

PowderedZetium.about.p: These sharpened zetium cutters are used to get better quality raw zetium dust which can then be processed into high quality industrial grade zetium. It can be stored and used more efficiently thus bolstering our zetium raising needs.
Each level increases zetium generation rate and storage.

TurretUpgradeTech.value: for turrets, both stationary and mobile.

TurretArmor.about.p: Advances in nanotechnology allows us to increase structural linking between basic molecules used in our defensive structures, thus increasing their resistance to damage and ensuring turret longevity.

TurretDamage.about.p: These particle chargers give our turret weapon systems substantial advantage over traditional projectiles. Supercharged projectiles travel faster and deliver more damage on impact, thus reducing enemies to shreds more quickly.

Mule.about.p: Upgrade increases ship's armor, volume, engines and damage absorption chance.

StorageSpecialization.about.p: This upgrate increases volume of [reference:Objects/Unit_Mule] class ships.

Trooper.about.p: Although they are our basic warriors they are a considerable force in numbers. This upgrade allows to further strengthen our main force by upgrading their weapons and armor.

Shocker.about.p: Enhances armor and rockets of already tough [reference:Units/Shocker.name] making them even more powerful in battle. Making them stronger helps them protect other units longer and their zetium enhanced rockets dishes out more damage.

Seeker.about.p: Upgrading weakly armored Seekers may give them a chance to lay that final winning shot upon your enemy. And even better - this technology even increases their damage by fitting them with zetium plated bullets.

Scorpion.about.p: Scorpion class vehicles can be fitted with better shield generators and faster particle accelerators. Investing into this research gives your basic unit advantage over same vehicles at your enemy side.

Azure.about.p: Mixing explosive materials in [reference:Units/Azure.name] rocket heads with zetium makes them more damaging and zetium also makes [reference:Units/Azure.name] hull more resistant to enemy shots.

Mantis.about.p: This technology increases power of Mantis machine gun and strengthens unit armor making it even more horrifying for our enemies.

Zeus.about.p: This technology increases velocity of tank projectiles thus increasing damage it does. It also thickens its armor so it could withstand more damage.

Crow.about.p: Upgrades [reference:Units/Crow.name] lasers and hull making it a better fighter that is cheap and cost effective to produce.

Cyrix.about.p: Fitting their lasers with high frequency zetium crystals improves [reference:Units/Cyrix.name] damage and shields. Researching this technology means your fleet can last longer and make more damage for same cost.

Rhyno.about.p: Upgrades already fearsome [reference:Units/Rhyno.name] Battlecruiser. This technology fortifies its armor with zetium plates making even harder to destroy and gives a formidable energy boost for its weapon systems making it the most fearsome ship in whole galaxy.

Dart.about.p: Improves longevity and damage for [reference:Units/Dart.name] class ships making them deadlier and allowing engaging enemies in fewer numbers.

Avenger.about.p: Upgrades [reference:Units/Avenger.name] making its rockets pass through more armor. Also upgrades its armor allowing to withstand more damage in unfortunate situation. Overall it makes [reference:Units/Avenger.name] class ships better interceptors.

Jumper.about.p: This research allows you to build Jumpers.

BuildingRepair.about.p: These mobile drones allow repairing even severely damaged buildings without having to tear building down and build it from ground up which makes them perfect for repairing heavily upgraded buildings. However this process takes time and building will not be operational while it is being repaired.
Allows repairing damaged buildings. Upgrading this technology reduces repair cost and time.

Alliances.about.p: Join forces with your neighbours. Protect each other. Coordinate your attacks. Help each other to complete quests. Anything is possible when you are not alone. So why wait? Create your alliance now!

MetalStorage.about.p: This technology increases resistance to pressure and temperature of our metal storages. By using higher degree of compression applied we can store even more metal to same buildings.

EnergyStorage.about.p: Don't have enough space for additional storages and you still have excess energy that you are wasting? Invest to this technology now!
With this technology we will be able to store more energy in existing buildings and will save our precious land for other constructions.

ZetiumStorage.about.p: This revolutionary way of storing zetium allows us to store even more of it to same existing storages. Research this technology to increase usefulness of our [obj:2:Building_ZetiumStorage::dc].

ShipStorage.about.p: Newly designed attachable cargo decks can be fitted to any cargo ship to extend its available storage. This allows them to transport more resources or units and is very convenient for those gathering or assault missions.

Gnat.about.p: Weakest unit from alien ground army. They are pretty weak and vulnerable and their lasers do not do much damage. However they tend to be in large groups thus compensating their weakness with their quantities.

Glancer.about.p: Highly vulnerable but deadly to infantry. Their sniper rifles pierce through light armor. It is better to dispose of Glancers quickly however their tendency to hide behind other units makes them hard targets.

Spudder.about.p: Semi-heavy humanoid robots. Armed with homing plasma particles they are a considerable threat for your troops. They fire multiple particles at once making them excellent troops against groups of weak opponents.

Gnawer.about.p: Guardians of most sacred artifacts in alien buildings. They are fierce killing machines destined to annihilate anyone who trespasses their ground. Highly armored hulls make them hard to destroy and their massive cannons offer versatility against infantry or tanks.

Dirac.about.p: These fast vessels were built as quick attackers in assault fleets. However today they can only be found in small groups all over Nebula 44 lurking in one place and attacking anyone who approaches their vicinity - may it be friend or foe.

Thor.about.p: These highly armored but fairly weak ships were used as a front line live shields long time ago. However now they are mostly scattered alone or with small groups of Diracs whom they still protect.
If you get a grasp on few of these ships know that they are pretty useful in air to ground bombardment of your enemy ground forces.

Demosis.about.p: These gigantic ships wander around in Nebula 44. Once built for great conquest now their simple robotic minds wait for orders from masters who are long gone.
But beware of their massive armor and weapons. Their laser is slow and requires some time to recharge but packs a powerful punch that is able to take down whole ships in a few shots.

Units.VpsAndCreds: Dealing damage to this ship gains you victory points. Also landing last killing shot to this ship awards player who dealt it with creds.

BossShip.about.p: Called after the god of sleep world this gigantic vessel appears from nowhere just to continue its existence in vast vacuum of space.

However dare not to disturb its peace or you will face the full power of its wrath. It is armed with plenty of weapons and its massive hulk can withstand firepower of whole armadas without much damage.

But adventurers and comanders are still trying to bring it down. Because even with ships threatening power facing them they know - obtaining secrets hidden well within this ship is a key to galactic domination.

ConvoyShip.about.p: These alien ships float across the galaxy in their slow pace. However they have nowhere to rush, because their wide array of weaponry and extremely thick armor allows them to fence off any attacker that dares to oppose them.

Trooper.about.p: Basic warriors of our armies armed with machine guns. They fearlessly run into battlefield bringing fear into our enemy hearts and confidence into our allies. Even if not very tough they can prove very useful in numbers.

Shocker.about.p: Highly armored field warriors with the capabilities to withstand enemy troop fire. Their rocket launchers are designed to counter more heavily armored opponents but massive shockers still work as best shields for your other anti-infantry units.

Seeker.about.p: Armed with [reference:InfoScreen/gun.sniper_rifle] they are lethal to lightly armored enemy units. Although deadly Seekers are very fragile and must be covered well behind the backs of other units or they will perish very quickly.

Scorpion.about.p: Scorpion class tanks are basic ground warfare vehicles. They pack a heavy punch with their [reference:InfoScreen/gun.cannon]. Scorpions are quite strong and armored and can take many enemy lives before giving up their own.

Azure.about.p: Azure hovertanks are best way of countering enemy tanks. Their twin rocket launchers on each side barrages battlefield with missiles devastating everything in their path. Hovertank technology stabilizes Azure while it's firing but makes it vulnerable to enemy shots so it should be shielded by other units.

Mantis.about.p: Mantis is a great anti-sniper measure as well as being capable of wiping other lighly armored units out of existence. However you should take notice that it itself does not have heavy armor and cannot withstand heavy fire. Cover them with your more armored units for best results.

Zeus.about.p: These massive tanks fortify themselves into the ground and shoot their projectiles into the space. They are designed to fight enemy spaceships and cannot target ground units.

Mdh.common.p: Mobile Deployable Headquarters (MDH) is used as first and primary base upon foreign colony. This massive vehicle deploys into a fully operational base with building construction capabilities, storage containers and even brings a small [reference:Buildings/MetalExtractor.name] and energy source.

Mdh.about.p: Beware! Although massive and big it is very fragile while undeployed. Do not let it get into battlefield or it will be damaged beyond repair very soon.

Mule.about.p: Slow and heavily armored transport unit. Its massive hull protects the cargo inside and allows deploying troops onto enemy battlefield even upon heavy fire.

Crow.about.p: Light, fast and versatile basic combat spaceship. Perfect for quick skirmishes and attacking lone enemy transporters.

Cyrix.about.p: Cyrix class battleships are standard combat ships used in our fleets. Their sturdy armor and formidable lasers vanquish our enemies whilst Cyrixes wade through space in their pride. Sometimes they are also used as shields for weaker ships like [reference:Dart.name] or [reference:Avenger.name].

Rhyno.about.p: Rhyno battlecruisers are flagships of any fleet. With their huge defences they can withstand massive fire and their array of weapons makes them strong against multiple types of enemies. However they are costly and their size makes them slow in travel.

Dart.about.p: Dart class ships were built specifically to counter [reference:Crow.name] and [reference:Avenger.name] class ships. They are fast and carry weapons deadly to those ships however they lack any solid protection from enemy fire.
They are best at hit and run attacks where they outnumber enemy to destroy them quickly and without casualties.

Avenger.about.p: Avengers are deadly against heavily armored ships. Their armor piercing rockets drill through and explode inside enemy ship hulls causing massive damage. Avenger fast engines ensure they can intercept [reference:Cyrix.name] and [reference:Rhyno.name] class ships easily and damage them severely.
However if Avengers are left in the battlefield they can suffer very quickly because they lack any kind of solid protection from enemy fire.

Jumper.about.p: Jumpers are lightning fast satellites that are used mainly for intelligence missions launched onto enemy planets. However because they were engineered for speed they lack any protection or guns and cannot sustain even lightest enemy fire.

MobileTurret.p: Can be transported in transporter ships. Does not shoot until deployed. Cannot be undeployed after deploying.

MobileVulcan.about.p: Mobile version of Vulcan defensive tower. [reference:MobileTurret]

MobileScreamer.about.p: Mobile version of Screamer defensive tower. [reference:MobileTurret]

MobileThunder.about.p: Mobile version of Thunder defensive tower. [reference:MobileTurret]
